Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2012 10:12AM jen70 wrote: My general surgeon in Austin is Lamar Jones with Austin surgeons. I had a BMX on the 12th. I have found him very responsive and willing to discuss my case. My cancer was a very common type, and I have been happy with my doctors, so I did not feel the need to go to MD Anderson. I would not have hesitated to do that however if I had a more advanced case, or an unusual diagnosis. I also have a derm and derm surgeon that I like if you need that reference.
Posts.Title: Austin, TX Breast Surgeon Recommedation maiyen maiyen

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2012 06:03PM jen70 wrote: Hi Rachel - I'm sorry you got bad news.  I got my diagnosis two weeks ago today.  I certainly understand the impatience!  These past couple of weeks have been nothing but hurry up and wait.  Getting appointments to see breast surgeon, oncologist and plastic surgeon, waiting on full pathology, BRACA test, etc.  I just had a bone scan and chest x-ray today.  More results to wait for.  I have decided to have a bilateral mastectomy and I just want it over with.  I know I need to go through this process but it is hard to wait, isn't it? Take care, and try to live your life as normally as possible while you go through this.  I've found that as long as I"m busy my mind doesn't have time to worry about all of the what ifs.  Jen
Posts.Title: Preliminary results are in RachelM11 christina0001

Posts.Content: Mar 6, 2012 08:49AM jen70 wrote: dlb, thinking good thoughts for you today...
Posts.Title: Another scared new person dlb66 jen70

Posts.Content: Mar 4, 2012 09:16AM jen70 wrote: I've been lurking too, but your story sounds so much like mine, I thought I would reply.  I got called back for a magnification mammo and, the radiologist remmended a stereotactic biopsy.  There were two areas of microcalcifications that were not present in my last mammo.  I didn't think to ask about the birads.  I am scheduled for the biopsy tomorrow am.  I just want it over with, because this waiting is killing me. I have three kiddos too, and of course my hubby is overseas on business while this is all happening.  I've only told a couple of people, so I'm happy to have found this site.
Posts.Title: Another scared new person dlb66 jen70

Posts.Content: Mar 4, 2012 08:18PM jen70 wrote: I know I shouldn't, but I'm having a glass of wine - maybe two.  I feel like I'm having a panic attack, and I really need to calm down about tomorrow.  Thanks dlb and jen333 for your well wishes.  Looking forward to tomorrow being in my rear view mirror.

Posts.Content: Mar 4, 2012 11:22AM jen70 wrote: Ha!  I'm doing the exact same thing today.  Laundry and cleaning this morning, and grocery shopping after the afternoon lacrosse games.  I have a sweet friend bringing us dinner tomorrow night.  Very grateful for that!  I have two boys, 12 and 14, and a 10 year old girl.  How old are yours?  I'm hoping to get back to my routine by Wednesday.  I was told to limit my activity at least through Tuesday.  Life goes on no matter what kind of news I get.  I just want the answer.  I do much better with a plan in mind.  :)
Posts.Title: Another scared new person dlb66 jen70

Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2012 03:21PM jen70 wrote: Just heard....They found cancerous cells in the ducts.  They are geting me in to see surgeon next week for a consult and to plan a biopsy of the lymphnodes.  How do I tell my kids about this?  And my Mom?  Crap.
Posts.Title: Another scared new person dlb66 jen70

Posts.Content: Mar 7, 2012 01:30PM jen70 wrote: The biopsy went fine, but it was pretty uncomfortable.  I was really sore yesterday, but it's better today.  I'm hoping to have results today, but no call yet. I'm sorry you got sick, no fun!  My husband will be home on Friday.  He's in touch as much as possible given a 14 hour time difference.  I've got a few friends looking out for me though.  Hoping for good results for both of us.
